definition: to pass on a story/to communicate a message
biography/historical narrative/commentaries/relay station
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
messenger/communicator/relay

sentences.english: You can leave a message now.
O:I'll connect you with the Message Desk.Just a moment,please.
sentences.chinese: 我幫您接通傳話櫃檯，請稍等。

sentences.english: This hides the rest of the file system from remote sessions.
sentences.chinese: 這樣就可以向遠程傳話隱藏文件系統的其他部分。

sentences.english: And take a message hoping to hear YangGuang play a xiao song.
sentences.chinese: 並且傳話希望聽到楊廣吹奏一首蕭曲。

sentences.english: Nope,she is out, can I take a message?
sentences.chinese: 不在，她出去了，要我傳話嗎？

definition: to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to appear in the news/in the papers
(accounting) to balance the books/to do the accounts/(fig.) to settle an account/to get one's revenge
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to assign (a task to sb)
to ask for instructions
reparations/to pay reparations
to tease/to poke fun at
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
internal affairs/domestic affairs/family affairs/(trad.) affairs within the palace
to decline/to avoid/shirking responsibilities/to blame others/to pass the buck/to unload one's responsibilities/to try to get out of a task
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
complete nonsense (idiom)
lit. to push the boat with the current/fig. to take advantage of the situation for one's own benefit
